intro: Chrysochosma leonina, commonly known as the golden starbursts, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. Chrysochosma leonina is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
